Description: 14 beads made of different shapes and colours. A: Nine of cylindrical segmented beads made of faience, no coloured glazing preserved. B: Three disc-shaped beads made of faience in light blue to green colour. C: One small barrel-shaped bead made of white faience. D: One bead that resembles a cylindrical segmented bead, with an oval section, two segments preserved but only partly separated.
Acquisition notes: Formerly housed by the Birmingham Museum and Art Gallery and the EES London.
